channel.title: Car Crashes
channel.description:
Alright, title mostly says it all, have you guys seen a car crash or have been in a car crash? I have a story to tell you guys that happened to me when I was 15 years old. I have had a good life, nothing bad had happened to me in my younger days, so I've been pretty lucky as a young child.
On February 15, 2008; I was home alone whilst my parents were driving to a party, there were reports of ice and heavy snow, they still went. I got a phone call about an hour later from the Denver police department saying that my parents had perished because of a semi-truck sliding into the wrong lane. They both died instantly. It's been very hard for me to get through this, well, as i'm typing this tears are building up. Please don't take this story as a plea for apologies, as that is not what i'm intending.
Anyways, back to the question, Have any of you been in a car crash? Or have seen a car crash with your very own eyes?

item.title: Car Crashes
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

I took a turn too sharp with bald tires (I didn’t check them often) and I totaled my car. I was alone and got away with a bloody nose.

Read full topic

item.title: Car Crashes
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

We have quite a few speed limits. The lowest is 15 km/h, on so called ‘woonerven’. Streets where pedestrians and cyclists are higher ‘ranked’ than cars. Then there is the urban area, where the max is 30 km/h. Then there’s the normal built-up area, where the max is 50 km/h. Outside the built-up area it’s either 70 or 80 km/h. On expressways it’s 100 km/h, and on motorways it’s 120 km/h. There’s currently one road where you are allowed to go 130 km/h, as a test.

Read full topic

item.title: Car Crashes
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I’ve been in two accidents:

My first lesson in drivers ed, I stopped at a stop sign, and the lady behind me came crashing into me because it was the first snowfall of the year and women don’t know how to drive.

A few months ago, I bumped into a trailer hitch on a huge truck, while in the Tim Hortons drive-through for coffee. Not a scratch and it seems he didn’t notice.

Read full topic

item.title: Car Crashes
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Well here We have speedlimits,

20mph residential roads such as towns / around schools nurseries…
30mph urban areas and villages
40mph/50mph, For roads inbetween urban areas/ Non built up areas.
National speed limit (for most vehicles 60mph for single carriageways and 70mph for motorways and dual carriageways)

Read full topic

item.title: Car Crashes
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It does vary by state, though, on interstates, the minimum is 65 generally. On highways (2 lane roads, not in town) it’s generally 55mph around here, and higher out west where it is flatter.

Read full topic

Most people I talk to seem to come up with figures lower than ours.

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:

item.title: Car Crashes
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I think you got the wrong impression of our speed limits from me when I was talking about the ones out west. In the more heavily populated areas, like the east coast to the Mississippi and slightly beyond, the max speed limit on the interstates in generally 65-70 mph. It’s only when you get further west into the great plains, deserts and such that it rises to 85-90 mph, presumably you would have those high speed limits too if your land was long, straight, and flat.

I actually meant they’re too low

Read full topic

item.description:

In New Zealand, the max speed a car is allowed to travel is 100km/h, but at the current fuel price I usually drive 85.

Talking about fuel prices, did you know that in Venezuela, fuel costs 1c/L?

The USA also tends to have more restrictions on road use than the UK, their speed limits are insane.

Ours are getting as bad though

item.title: Car Crashes
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I’ll happily vouch and say an awful lot of the drivers on the roads in the UK are fucking idiots.

The amount of people who are too lazy to indicate…

America will have more accidents simply because of the larger population. The UK’s population density probably makes us pretty bad too though!

Read full topic

item.title: Car Crashes
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can always find statistics to say anything. But I’d think the statistics would be fairly close if they took into account everything that is possible. Problem is you can’t take into account differing road conditions, weather conditions, etc etc. The USA has to have millions of more miles of road than the UK, in addition to all sorts of weather ranging from 50F below zero all the way up to 130F+.

Read full topic

item.title: Car Crashes
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:384477”][quote author=TheBeanie link=topic=480244.msg3516154#msg3516154 date=1299015450]
this is why i prefer to live in the UK where we get taught how to drive properly, Yes we have bad accidents but i bet no where near as many as the average person in the US
[/quote]

That’s a pretty ignorant statement to make. Just as there are idiots everywhere, there are bad drivers everywhere.[/quote]

I knew i would get this exact reply from you lol.

Yes we have idiot drivers in the UK… what im saying is im willing to bet a whole £5 that the UK has alot less crashes per person on the road then the US does.

Read full topic

item.title: Car Crashes
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

I remember when I was 12 we (my family) were approaching a roundabout and saw two fire engines with sirens blaring speed around the roundabout, both of them toppled, my dad went and helped get the fire fighters out but all they were worried about was getting to the scene. It turned out it was just round the corner so a group of them got loads of equipment and jogged there.

Read full topic
